summary: The document presents a detailed account of the President's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board meeting held on April 23, 1963, focusing on intelligence and covert operations related to Cuba. It includes discussions on the status of clandestine agents, U.S. policy towards Cuba, the withdrawal and remaining presence of Soviet military personnel, challenges in penetrating Soviet communications, and the coordination of U.S. agencies' activities concerning Cuba.
key_findings: Discussion on the status and activities of clandestine agents in Cuba, including the number of agents and reports produced.
Insights into the U.S. policy towards Cuba, emphasizing the responsibility of the Cuban people for their liberation and the limited expectation of a popular uprising against Castro.
Details on the withdrawal of Soviet military personnel from Cuba and the estimated remaining Soviet presence.
Challenges in penetrating Soviet communications in Cuba, including efforts to solve Soviet encryption systems.
Coordination efforts among U.S. agencies regarding Cuba, including the role of the Cottrell Committee in policy recommendations and execution.
